thread.title: Sherlock's huge ratings confirm its status as one of UK's most-loved shows ahead of finale
thread.title_full: Sherlock's huge ratings confirm its status as one of UK's most-loved shows ahead of finale

author: Tom Powell
title: Sherlock's huge ratings confirm its status as one of UK's most-loved shows ahead of finale
text:
Sunday 15 January 2017 09:21 BST Click to followThe Evening Standard Sherlock: the writers have said another series is 'possible' BBC/Hartswood Films/Robert Viglasky 
Ratings for the latest series of Sherlock have confirmed its status as one the UK's most-watched TV shows ahead of Sunday's finale. 
More than 11 million viewers saw the episode broadcast on New Year's Day: the biggest audience of the festive period. 
A similar number tuned in for the episode on January 1 2016, which was also the most-watched TV drama of the year. 
With another large audience expected for the series finale on Sunday night, the BBC will be hoping Sherlock's creators Steven Moffat and Mark Gatiss are not about to walk away from the show for good. 
Moffat said this week that another series was "possible", and that he and Gatiss were not currently planning Sunday's episode to be Sherlock's farewell. Read more
